EC2NewGen.^description: Instance Type Currency: {$COUNT} of your instances are running in an older generation of instance type. Upgrade to the latest generation of instance type to gain better perfomance and lower cost.

EC2DetailedMonitor.^description: Detailed Monitoring: Detailed Monitoring has not been enabled for {$COUNT} of your instances. Enable Detailed Monitoring to get monitoring metrics with higher frequency.

EC2IamProfile.^description: IAM Instance Profile: {$COUNT} of your instances lack an IAM profile association. Associate IAM profile to control AWS API request securely.

EC2EIPNotInUse.^description: Elastic IP Not In Use: {$COUNT} of your Elastic IP is not associated to any instance. Release unused Elastic IP to save cost.

EC2MemoryMonitor.^description: EC2 Memory Monitoring: Memory monitoring has not been enabled for {$COUNT} of your instances. Install CloudWatch agent and enable the monitoring

EC2DiskMonitor.^description: EC2 Disk Monitoring: Disk monitoring has not been enabled for {$COUNT} of your instances. Install CloudWatch agent and enable the monitoring

EC2Active.^description: EC2 Active: {$COUNT} of your instances have not been running for more than 7 days. Terminate intances that are not required.

EC2SGNumber.^description: EC2 Security Group Association: {$COUNT} of your instances have more than 50 security groups associated. Please reduce the number of security groups.

EC2LowUtilization.^description: EC2 Low Utilization: {$COUNT} of your instances have low utilization. Decrease instance size to save cost.

EC2HighUtilization.^description: EC2 High Utilization: {$COUNT} of your instances have high utilization. Increase instance size to improve performance.

EC2InstancePublicIP.^description: EC2 with Public IP: {$COUNT} of your instances associated public IP. Disable unused public IP from instances.

EC2InstanceAutoPublicIP.^description: EC2 with Auto Assign IP: {$COUNT} of your instances enabled auto-assign public IP. Disable unused public IP from instances.

EC2SubnetAutoPublicIP.^description: EC2 Subnet with Auto Assign IP: {$COUNT} of your instances has enabled auto-assign public IP in subnet configuration.
EC2SubnetAutoPublicIP.shortDesc: EC2 Subnet with Auto Assign IP

EC2HasTag.^description: EC2 without tagging: {$COUNT} of your instances has no tagging. Tag your EC2 instances.

EBSEncrypted.^description: Storage Encyrption: {$COUNT} of EBS storage volumes are not encrypted. Enable encryption for EBS volumes to meet security and compliance requirements.

EBSNewGen.^description: Storage Type Currency: {$COUNT} of EBS volumes are on an older storage type. Upgrade to latest generation of storage type to gain better performance and lower cost

EBSInUse.^description: Storage Utilization: {$COUNT} of EBS storage volumes are not attached to any instances. Remove unused volumes to reduce the storage cost.
ref: [Controlling AWS costs by deleting unused Amazon EBS volumes]<https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/mt/controlling-your-aws-costs-by-deleting-unused-amazon-ebs-volumes/>

EBSSnapshot.^description: Storage Snapshot: {$COUNT} of EBS has no snapshot(s) available. Enable regular backups to prevent data loss.

EBSUpToDateSnapshot.^description: Storage Snapshot Up To Date: {$COUNT} of EBS has outdated snapshots. Take a new snapshot.

EBSSnapshotIsPublic.^description: Public Snapshot: {$COUNT} of EBS snapshots is available to public. Modify snapshot permission to private.

EBSLowUtilization.^description: EBS Low Utilization: {$COUNT} of EBS volume has less than 1 IOPS utilization for past 7 days. Remove volumes that are not required to reduce costs.
ref: [Controlling AWS costs by deleting unused Amazon EBS volumes]<https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/mt/controlling-your-aws-costs-by-deleting-unused-amazon-ebs-volumes/>

EBSFastSnapshot.^description: EBS Fast Snapshot Enabled: {$COUNT} of EBS volumes has Fast Snapshot Restores enabled. Only enable Fast Snapshot Restore if necessary as it will generate additional cost.

SGDefaultInUsed.^description: Default Security Group: {$COUNT} of default security groups are utilized. It is recommended to create custom security group that configured with specific rules.

SGSensitivePortOpenToAll.^description: Sensitive ports open to all: {$COUNT} of security group have sensitive ports (DNS, MongoDB, MSSQL, MySQL, NFS, OracleDB PostgreSQL, RDP, SMTP, SMTPS, SSH) open to all IPs. Recommend to open only for required IP.

SGAllTCPOpen.^description: All TCP Ports Open: {$COUNT} security groups has all TCP ports open. It is recommended to open only specific ports that are required.

SGAllUDPOpen.^description: All UDP Ports Open: {$COUNT} security groups has all UDP ports open. It is recommended to open only specific ports that are required.

SGAllPortOpen.^description: All Ports Open: {$COUNT} of security group has all ports open. It is recommended to open only specific ports that are required.

SGAllPortOpenToAll.^description: All Ports Open to All: {$COUNT} of security group has all port open to all IP. It is recommended to open only specific ports to specific IPs that are required.

SGEncryptionInTransit.^description: Encryption In Transit: {$COUNT} of security group has ports enabled without encryption in transit. It is recommended to use ports with encryption in transit

SGRuleNumber.^description: High Number of Rules: {$COUNT} of security group have more than 50 rules. Restructure and reuse the rules.

SGDefaultDisallowTraffic.^description: Default Security Group with Rules: {$COUNT} of default security group have rules. Remove rules in default security group

ComputeOptimizerEnabled.^description: Compute Optimizer Not Enabled: Compute Optimizer of your account is not enabled. Enable Compute Optimizer to get resources recommendations.

CEReservedInstance.^description: Reserved Instance Recommendation: Reserved Instances recommendations available in Cost Explorer

CESavingsPlans.^description: Savings Plans Recommendation: Savings Plans recommendations available in Cost Explorer

ELBListenerInsecure.^description: Insecure Listener: {$COUNT} of ELB listeners are using insecure protocols. Please use secure protocols.

ELBSGNumber.^description: ELB Security Group Association: {$COUNT} of your ELBs have more than 50 security groups associated. Please reduce the number of security groups

ELBCrossZone.^description: ELB Cross Zone Load Balancing: {$COUNT} of your ELBs do not have cross zone load balancing enabled. Enable cross zone load balancing to improve availability.

ELBConnectionDraining.^description: ELB Connection Draining: {$COUNT} of your ELBs have not enabled connection draining.

ELBClassicLB.^description: ELB Classic Load Balancer: {$COUNT} of your ELBs are Classic Load Balancers. Migrate to a newer generation of ELB.

ELBEnableWAF.^description: ALB Web Application Firewall: {$COUNT} of your ALBs have not enabled WAF.

ELBSGRulesMatch.^description: ALB Security Group Rules Configuration: {$COUNT} of Security Group in your ALBs has different port opened.

ASGELBHealthCheckValidation.^description: ELB Health Check Validation: {$COUNT} of your ASG have ELB health check enabled without ELB association.

ASGELBHealthCheckEnabled.^description: ELB Health Check Enabled: {$COUNT} of your ASG ELB association without ELB health check enabled

ASGInstancesRemoved.^description: Instance Removed: {$COUNT} of your ASG have no instances association.

ASGTargetGroupELBExist.^description: Target Group without ELB: {$COUNT} of target group your ASG have no ELB association.

ASGClassicLBExist.^description: Classic LB Deleted: {$COUNT} of your ASG are associated with a deleted Classic Load Balancer.

ASGAMIExist.^description: Launch Configuration/Template AMI Deleted: {$COUNT} of Launch Configuration/Template AMI of your ASG are using deleted AMI

ASGIMDSv2.^description: Launch Configuration/Template IMDSv2: {$COUNT} of Launch Configuration/Template have not enable IMDSv2
